4. november 9: visitor is Dallas; home is Colorado. Not an away game.
5. november 11: visitor is Colorado; home is Vancouver. Away game.

7. november 17: visitor is Colorado; home is Calgary. Wait, but earlier, on November 1, Calgary was the visitor to Colorado. Now, on November 17, it's reversed—Calgary is the home team, so Colorado is the visitor again. So this counts as an away game for them.
8. november 18: visitor is Calgary; home is Colorado. Not an away game.
9. november 20: visitor is Colorado; home is Edmonton. Away game.
10. november 22: visitor is Chicago; home is Colorado. Not an away game.
11. november 25: visitor is Colorado; home is Montreal. Away game.

13. november 29: visitor is Colorado; home is New Jersey. Away game.

Now, let me count how many times Colorado is the visitor (i.e., playing away games):

- November 20: Edmonton vs Colorado – away
- November 25: Montreal vs Colorado – away

- November 29: New Jersey vs Colorado – away

That's indeed 9 games. So the claim is correct—Colorado played 9 away games in November 1995-96.
